meanings.definition: Snaggles (noun): a group of teeth that are crooked or uneven
meanings.sent1: Her snaggles made her smile unique.
meanings.sent2: The dentist recommended braces to fix her snaggles.
meanings.sent3: The little girl giggled, showing off her snaggles.
meanings.sent4: His snaggles were like a row of misaligned soldiers.
meanings.sent5: The pirate's grin revealed a treasure trove of snaggles.

meanings.definition: Snaggles (verb): to catch or become caught on something with a jagged edge
meanings.sent1: The fabric snaggles easily on rough surfaces.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to snaggles your sweater on the nail.
meanings.sent3: The fishing line snaggles on a hidden branch.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts snaggles on the memory of his smile.
meanings.sent5: The kite snaggles in the tree, refusing to come down.

meanings.definition: Snaggles (adjective): having jagged or uneven edges
meanings.sent1: The snaggles edges of the rock were sharp.
meanings.sent2: She avoided the snaggles path to prevent injuries.
meanings.sent3: The old fence had a charmingly snaggles appearance.
meanings.sent4: The snaggles outline of the mountain was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The snaggles surface of the ice made walking treacherous.
